metadata.title: CVE-2015-5073 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the find_fixedlength function inpcre_compile.c in PCRE before 8.38 allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (crash) or obtain sensitive information from heap memoryand possibly bypass the ASLR protection mechanism via a crafted regularexpression with an excess closing parenthesis.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5073` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre3 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
libpcrecpp0 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
pcregrep - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pcre3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1').
